Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 87 runs, pivotal to India's 229/9 total
Mohammed Shami took 4/22, sixth four-plus wicket haul in men's ODI World Cups
Jasprit Bumrah took 3/32, removing Malan and Root off successive balls
India defended 10 runs in the final over to win by 100 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma: 'This was a game where we showed a lot of character. All the experienced players stood up at the right time and won us the game.'
Rohit Sharma: 'Looking at the overall picture, I thought we were 30 runs short.'
Rohit Sharma: 'Our seamers exploited the conditions very well, there was swing and lateral movement available.'
Rohit Sharma: 'We have got a good balance there. A couple of good spinners and seamers bringing in their experience.'
Jos Buttler: 'Very disappointed. At the halfway stage, chasing 230, we would have fancied ourselves. Same old story.'
Jos Buttler: 'It is all about execution. The answer is on a postcard, I think.'
Jos Buttler: 'Eight of their batters reached double-digits but only Livingstone (27) could cross 20.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India maintained their unbeaten streak with a 100-run win
India regained the top spot in the points table
England stayed rooted to the bottom of the points table
